data.title: The best moments of the 96th Oscars and more TV news and listings for March 11, 2024.
data.meta_description: One day, Tater. One day. https://www.tiktok.com/@frenchie_space/video/7343277521405824261 Here's A BUNCH OF TV News The Oscars were last night, and I'm not doing a whole recap because ain't nobody got time for all that. Instead, a few highlights: Kimmel arguing in real time with Former President 91 Charges, and quipping, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it past your jail time?‚Äù Kimmel‚Ä¶
data.text:
One day, Tater. One day.

@frenchie_space

My dad has so much faith in me‚Ä¶ Credit: @tatertot.frenchie . . . . . . #frenchbulldogs #frenchiebabyyü•∞ #frenchielifestyleüê∂‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞ #frenchiepuppylove‚ù§Ô∏è #animalsoftiktok #frenchiepuppylove‚ù§Ô∏èüêæ #frenchiebabyyü•∞ #frenchieoftheday #frenchiepuppy #frenchiepuppylove #dogsoftiktok

‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì French Bulldog ‚Äì French Bulldog

Here‚Äôs A BUNCH OF TV News

The Oscars were last night, and I‚Äôm not doing a whole recap because ain‚Äôt nobody got time for all that. Instead, a few highlights:

Kimmel arguing in real time with Former President 91 Charges, and quipping, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it past your jail time?‚Äù Kimmel was apparently instructed to not read the post on-air, but he did it anyway, and we are all better for it.

Kimmel roasting the Academy for not nominating Greta Gerwig and Margot Robie:

‚Äú‚ÄòBarbie‚Äô was a monster hit. What an achievement to take a plastic doll nobody even liked anymore. Before this movie, you had a better chance of getting my wife to buy our daughter a pack of Marlboro Reds than a Barbie doll. Now, Barbie‚Äôs a feminist icon thanks to Greta Gerwig, who many believed deserved to be nominated for Best Director. I know you‚Äôre clapping, but you‚Äôre the ones who didn‚Äôt vote for her, by the way. Don‚Äôt act like you had nothing to do with this.‚Äù

Jimmy Kimmel roasting the Directors Guild of America for immediately folding during the strikes.

‚ÄúWe were on strike for a long time, for 148 days. For five months, this group of writers, actors and directors, the people who actually make the films, said we will not accept a deal,‚Äù Kimmel praised. ‚ÄúWell, not the directors, you guys folded immediately.‚Äù

Cord Jefferson urging Hollywood to invest in smaller movies when accepting his Oscar for American Fiction (which is a wonderful film, by the way):

‚ÄúI understand that this is a risk-averse industry, but $200 million movies are also a risk. But you take the risk anyway,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúInstead of making one $200 million movie, make 20 $10 million movies or 50 $4 million movies.‚Äù

‚ÄúI want other people to experience that joy. The next Martin Scorsese is out there. The next Greta [Gerwig] is out there. The next Christopher Nolan is out there. They just want a shot. And we can give them one.‚Äù

HE‚ÄôS NOT WRONG.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm Just Ken.‚Äù Perfect. No notes.

Naked Cena.

Beautiful people in beautiful clothes.

Barbieheimer.

The playing of ‚ÄúP.I.M.P.‚Äù when Anatomy of a Fall won Best Adapted Screenplay (If you haven‚Äôt seen the movie, it‚Äôs a big part of the story)

The Bradley Cooper guest spot on the episode of Abbott Elementary that aired immediately after the Oscars.

BUT HOW DO YOU SIDELINE LANCE REDDICK, TREAT WILLIAMS AND NORMAN LEAR?

But honestly, this series is all the Oscars you really need:

@theangryinfj

Poor Dear Pamela, RIP #filmtok #oscars #oscars2024 #academyawards #saltburn #barbie #poorthings #americanfiction #careymulligan #katemckinnon #sterlingkbrown #ryangosling #markruffalo #funny #series #movies

‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì Angry INFJ

@theangryinfj

Replying to @_skinnyem_ Part 5 There were too many clips from Bottoms to choose from #filmtok #oscars #oscars2024 #academyawards #poorthings #barbie #americanfiction #saltburn #bottoms #emmastone #ryangosling #movies #funny #series

‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì Angry INFJ

Max is about to be the next streamer to crack down on password sharing, enraging parents of college kids everywhere.

Ike Barinholtz is no dummy.

Apparently, Jeopardy! isn‚Äôt Brits‚Äô cup of tea.

Yeah, I‚Äôm not sure people who have already had some success in the music business should be allowed to compete on The Voice. I also don‚Äôt think people with such stupid hair should be allowed on TV. I don‚Äôt know how you enforce either of these things, though.

There is a whole other universe in which De La Soul was the Fresh Prince of Bel-Air, where I guess they slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars, too.

Apple TV has expanded its film offerings, adding more than 50 new movies, most in 4k.

Another day, another update on the mythical Community movie.

WAR OF THE HOUSEWIVES: a bunch of Real Housewives have come to Andy Cohen‚Äôs defense against the allegations lodged at him by Leah McSweeney and Brandi Glanville.

Sounds like a Mandalorian movie is replacing a fourth season.

The creators of Evil have no plans to shop it elsewhere after being canceled at Paramount+. BOO.

And if you enjoyed Jodie Foster in True Detective, I have some disappointing news for you.

Looking to buy a haunted hotel?

Well, well, well, look who showed up to the premiere of his movie after all.

The crisis in Israel and Gaza is spilling over into the Eurovision Song Contest.

Sending Sinbad all good thoughts:

Congratulations, Vanessa Hudgens!

I love Christina Applegate so much, and hate that she‚Äôs suffering.

Renewals

Tracker has been renewed for a second season on CBS.

Crime Scene Kitchen has been renewed for a third season on Fox.

Side Hustlers has been renewed for a second season on Roku.

Cancellations

Upload has been renewed for a fourth and final season on Prime Video.

Avatar: The Last Airbender has been renewed for a second and third final season on Netflix.

The Brothers Sun has been canceled after one season on Netflix.

Break Point has been canceled after two seasons on Netflix.

Our Flag Means Death is officially canceled as no one else wanted to pick up a third season.

In Development

A Baywatch reboot is in the works at Fox.

Halloween is being adapted into a television series.

An untitled thriller starring Kim Kardashian has been bought by Prime Video.

Down in the Valley has been greenlit at Starz.

The Real Full Monty has been acquired by Fox.

Drunk in Love is in development at Peacock.

Triumph: Jesse Owens and the Berlin Olympics; Jim Thorpe; and an untitled third project are being developed at The History Channel.

Tales From the Void has been acquired at Screambox.

Mentiras, a series based on the Mexican stage musical starring Belinda and Luis Gerardo M√©ndez, is in the works at Prime Video.

Casting News

Zach Galifianakis and Kumail Nanjiani have joined Only Murders in the Building on Hulu.

Patton Oswalt will host The 1% Club on Prime Video.

Ramy Youssef will host Saturday Night Live on March 30 with musical guest Travis Scott.

Patrick J. Adams, Connor Swindells, and Merritt Wever have been added to the cast of Lockerbie on Netflix and BBC.

Aristotle Athari has joined Hacks on Max.

Austin Stowell has been cast as Young Gibbs in NCIS: Origins on CBS.

Lisa Vanderpump has joined Gordon Ramsay‚Äôs Food Stars on Fox.

Christian Kane will reprise his role as Jacob Stone in The Librarians: The Next Chapter on The CW.

Omar Metwally, Amirah Vann, Jon Ecker, Anya Banerjee, Scott Wolf, and Patrick Walker have joined Doc on Fox.

Clayton Cardenas has joined the cast of The Abandons on Netflix.

Melissa Joan Hart and La La Anthony will star in The Bad Guardian on Lifetime.

Keltie Knight will co-host E! News on E!

Rebecca Ferguson will co-star in Mercy from Amazon MGM.

Mark Your Calendar

Ripley debuts on Netflix on April 4.

The Kardashians will return on May 23.

Black Twitter: A People‚Äôs History debuts on Hulu on May 9.

The Real Housewives of Dubai returns on Bravo on June 2.

Dinner Party Diaries with Jose Andres premieres on Prime Video on March 19.

A Gentleman in Moscow premieres on Paramount+ on March 29.

Sex and the City will begin streaming on Netflix on April 1.

House of the Dragon will return on HBO in June.

Conan O‚ÄôBrien Must Go will debut on Max on April 18.

Unsung and Uncensored return on TV One on March 3.

Homicide: New York premieres on Netflix on March 20.

Tryouts will premiere on ESPN+ on April 10.

Fox released their summer premiere dates:

Don‚Äôt Forget The Lyrics! and I Can See Your Voice on May 16.

Gordon Ramsay‚Äôs Food Stars on May 22.

Beat Shazam returns on May 28.

The Quiz with Balls premieres on May 28.

MasterChef: Generations on May 29.

Name That Tune on June 3.

R.I.P.

Iris Apfel, Fashion icon and designer

Post by @jennyfromthebox

View on Threads

Jean Allison, Actress who had appeared in more than 80 television series, including ‚ÄúMaverick, Bonanza, Perry Mason, 77 Sunset Strip, The Dick Van Dyke Show, Gunsmoke, Adam-12, Ironside, and St. Elsewhere,‚Äù

Chris Mortensen, Award-winning sports journalist

Mark Dodson, Voice actor on Return of the Jedi, Gremlins and others

Jenne Casarotto, Co-founder of British agency Casarotto Ramsay & Associates

WATCH THIS

The McBee Dynasty: Real American Cowboys: For Yellowstone fans, this reality show follows the McBees, a real-life ranching family whose business is on the brink of becoming a billion-dollar industry. What is fascinating here is that it is being produced by NBCUniversal who also created ‚ÄúThe Real Housewives‚Äù franchises ‚Äî which themselves originally positioned themselves as the reality version of The O.C. I mean, why mess with a successful formula, right? Series premiere. Peacock

Young Royals: Season three. Netflix

The Bachelor: Joey the Bachelor goes on the shudder-inducing fantasy suite dates with his final three. 7 p.m., ABC

Late Night:

Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon: Ewan McGregor, Mary Elizabeth Winstead, Evan Rachel Wood, Marcus King

Late Night with Seth Meyers: Bowen Yang, Kara Swisher, Aric Improta

The Late Show with Stephen Colbert: Kristen Stewart, Tom Hollander

After Midnight: Randy Sklar, Jason Sklar

Jimmy Kimmel Live: Dwayne Johnson, Justin Timberlake

The Daily Show: Host Jon Stewart

Watch What Happens Live: Awkwafina, Ayesha Curry
